Description: Cancer Associated Thrombosis (CAT) is a major source of cancer related morbidity and mortality. This special session of interest is being held as a joint session between ASCO and AACR because of the potential for optimal CAT prevention and treatment to improve outcomes in cancer patients. The session, which brings together global leaders in CAT, will discuss CAT epidemiology, advances in our understanding of CAT pathogenesis, and a deep dive into the science and implementation of current and future prevention and treatment strategies.
SearchResultBody: SS02. AACR-ASCO Joint Session: Pathophysiology and New Treatments for Cancer-Associated Thrombosis
Title: AACR-ASCO Joint Session: Pathophysiology and New Treatments for Cancer-Associated Thrombosis
